summary: This is a mortgage document for a property located at 116 East 65th Street, New York, NY, securing a loan of $9,045,000 from Citibank, N.A. The mortgage is recorded under MERS as the mortgagee of record. It details the terms, borrower obligations, and property description. This document is a standard mortgage security instrument (deed of trust) outlining the borrower's obligations regarding escrow payments, property insurance, maintenance, and default conditions. It appears to be a generic loan document, not directly related to Epstein case events, but part of a financial records dataset. This document is a mortgage security instrument and adjustable rate rider for a property in New York, NY 10066-7007, dated April 14, 2018. It outlines the loan terms, borrower obligations, lender rights, and details an adjustable interest rate tied to LIBOR, with Citibank, N.A. as the lender. It is a standard loan document, not directly referencing Epstein case events or individuals. This document is an 'Interest Only Period Adjustable Rate Rider' for a mortgage note, detailing the terms for interest rate adjustments, payment calculations, and limits on rate changes. It appears to be a standard financial form with no direct mention of Epstein case individuals or events.

keyFacts: A mortgage for $9,045,000 was taken out on the property at 116 East 65th Street, New York, NY, on April 14, 2016.
The mortgagee/lender of record is MERS (Mortgage Electronic Registration Systems, Inc.), acting as nominee for the actual lender, Citibank, N.A.
The borrower's identity is not fully disclosed in this document excerpt; it is redacted or partially obscured, referenced only as 'Borrower' with a Unit and New York, NY address.
The property is legally described as a plot in Manhattan with specific boundaries and an Assessor's Parcel Number (Property Tax ID) of 508506.
The loan is scheduled to be paid in full by May 1, 2046.
Document is a standard Uniform Instrument mortgage security agreement.
No named individuals related to the Epstein case are mentioned in this text chunk.
The text is purely contractual boilerplate for a residential mortgage loan.
It references New York and federal entities (FEMA) but no case-specific locations.
This appears to be background financial documentation without evident connections to Epstein activities.
Document is a mortgage security instrument and adjustable rate rider dated April 14, 2018.
The property address is New York, NY 10066-7007.
The initial fixed interest rate is 2.260%, changing to an adjustable rate on May 1, 2019, based on LIBOR.
The document contains standard loan covenants, default provisions, and New York State law governing clauses.
Document is a standard adjustable-rate mortgage rider from Citibank/Wolters Kluwer Financial Services.
Specifies an initial interest-only period with the first principal and interest payment due June 1, 2026.
Contains no references to Jeffrey Epstein, associates, victims, or related legal matters.
Appears to be a routine financial document unrelated to the Epstein case investigation.
